target_claim: The Valley of Flowers National Park is a nature reserve in the western Himalayas of Uttarakhand, India. It covers an area of 87.5 square kilometers (33.8 sq mi) and has no permanent human population. Being part of the Nanda Devi Biosphere Reserve, it serves as one of the last refuges for several endangered species, including the Asiatic black bear and snow leopard.
